newsitem.title: PERU: Peru's November gold output rises 8.3 percent.
newsitem.headline: Peru's November gold output rises 8.3 percent.

text.p: Peru's gold output rose 8.3 percent to 5.3 tonnes in November compared to the same month last year, according to preliminary figures from Energy and Mines Ministry released Friday.
Production rose 16 percent to 59.7 tonnes in the first 11 months of the year against the same period last year.

Peru is Latin America's second largest gold producer after Brazil and the 12th largest in the world. The country's largest gold producer is Minera Yanacocha S.A., a joint venture operated by Newmont Mining Co.
The ministry's figures include estimates for output by Peru's informal gold miners, who account for about 40 percent of national output.
